remarks.para: The namespace exposes objects that represent all of the controls and user interface (UI) elements that are supported by visual styles. To draw or get information about a particular element, you must set a to the element you are interested in. A is automatically set to a specified in the constructor, but you can also set an existing to a different element by calling the method.
To draw an element, use the method. The class also includes methods, such as and , that provide information about how an element is defined by the current visual style.

The constructor and many of the methods throw exceptions unless visual styles are enabled in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the client area of application windows. To check for these conditions, use the static property.

The class wraps the functionality of the visual styles (UxTheme) API from the Windows Shell portion of the Windows Platform SDK. For more information about visual styles, see "Using Windows XP Visual Styles" in the Platform SDK portion of the MSDN Library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library.

summary.para: Provides methods for drawing and getting information about a . This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.para: This constructor uses the , , and properties of the parameter to initialize the , , and properties.
Before using this constructor, you should call the static method to verify whether the current visual style provides a definition for the element specified by the parameter.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class using the given .

Docs.param: A that this will represent.

Docs.param: The class name of the element that this will represent.

remarks.para: This property identifies a group of related controls or user interface (UI) elements. For more information about the class, part, and state of a visual style element, see the class.

summary.para: Gets the class name of the current visual style element.

MemberSignature.Value: public void DrawBackground (System.Drawing.IDeviceContext dc, System.Drawing.Rectangle bounds);

remarks.para: This method draws the background of the current visual style element specified by the , , and properties.
If the or of the rectangle specified by the parameter is less than 0, the method will return without drawing the background.

The background of a visual style element can be a bitmap file or a filled border. To determine the background type, call the method with an argument value of . To determine whether the element background will scale to fit the specified bounds, call the method with an argument value of .

summary.para: Draws the background image of the current visual style element within the specified bounding rectangle.

Docs.param: The used to draw the background image.
A in which the background image is drawn.

MemberSignature.Value: public void DrawBackground (System.Drawing.IDeviceContext dc, System.Drawing.Rectangle bounds, System.Drawing.Rectangle clipRectangle);

remarks.para: This method draws the background of the current visual style element specified by the , , and properties. The background will be clipped to the area specified by the parameter.
If the or of the rectangle specified by either the or parameters is less than 0, the method will return without drawing the background.

The background of a visual style element can be a bitmap file or a filled border. To determine the background type, call the method with an argument value of . To determine whether the element background will scale to fit the specified bounds, call the method with an argument value of .

summary.para: Draws the background image of the current visual style element within the specified bounding rectangle and clipped to the specified clipping rectangle.

Docs.param: The used to draw the background image.
A in which the background image is drawn.
A that defines a clipping rectangle for the drawing operation.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Drawing.Rectangle GetBackgroundContentRectangle (System.Drawing.IDeviceContext dc, System.Drawing.Rectangle bounds);

remarks.para: A visual style can define a content area within each background image. This is the area in which content such as text and icons can be placed without overwriting background borders. This method uses the given background area to calculate the content area for the current visual style element.

summary.para: Returns the content area for the background of the current visual style element.

returns.para: A that contains the content area for the background of the current visual style element.

Docs.param: The this operation will use.
A that contains the entire background area of the current visual style element.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Drawing.Rectangle GetBackgroundExtent (System.Drawing.IDeviceContext dc, System.Drawing.Rectangle contentBounds);

remarks.para: A visual style can define a content area within each background image. This is the area in which content such as text and icons can be placed without overwriting background borders. This method uses the given content area to calculate the entire background area for the current visual style element.

summary.para: Returns the entire background area for the current visual style element.

returns.para: A that contains the entire background area of the current visual style element.

Docs.param: The this operation will use.
A that contains the content area of the current visual style element.

A that contains the entire background area of the current visual style element.

remarks.para: Visual styles use a set of Boolean values to describe some properties of the elements defined by a style. These properties are encapsulated by the values.

summary.para: Returns the value of the specified Boolean property for the current visual style element.

returns.para: true if the property specified by the parameter is true for the current visual style element; otherwise, false.

Docs.param: One of the values that specifies which property value to retrieve for the current visual style element.

remarks.para: Visual styles use a set of color values to describe some properties of the elements defined by a style. These properties are encapsulated by the values.

summary.para: Returns the value of the specified color property for the current visual style element.

returns.para: A that contains the value of the property specified by the parameter for the current visual style element.

Docs.param: One of the values that specifies which property value to retrieve for the current visual style element.

remarks.para: Visual styles use a set of enumerated types to describe some properties of the elements defined by a style. These enumerated types are encapsulated by the values.

summary.para: Returns the value of the specified enumerated type property for the current visual style element.

returns.para: The integer value of the property specified by the parameter for the current visual style element.

Docs.param: One of the values that specifies which property value to retrieve for the current visual style element.

remarks.para: Visual styles can specify the names of image files that are used to draw a particular element in different sizes and resolutions. These file names are encapsulated by the values.

returns.para: A that contains the value of the property specified by the parameter for the current visual style element.

Docs.param: One of the values that specifies which property value to retrieve for the current visual style element.

remarks.para: This property is used internally by the methods. If the class of elements specified by the property is not defined by the current visual style, then this property returns .

This property value is invalidated when the visual style of the operating system changes, or when the user disables visual styles. If you access this property directly, your code should query this property again to get a new handle when the event is raised with the property value of .

summary.para: Gets a unique identifier for the current class of visual style elements.

summary.para: Determines whether the specified visual style element is defined by the current visual style.

returns.para: true if the combination of the and properties of are defined; otherwise, false.

Docs.param: A whose class and part combination will be verified.

remarks.para: The following table describes how to individually check for each of the three conditions that must exist for the property to return true.

term.para: The operating system supports visual styles.

description.para: Verify that the property of the class is true.

term.para: The user has enabled visual styles in the operating system.

description.para: Verify that the property of the class is true.

term.para: Visual styles are being used to draw the client area of application windows.

description.para: Verify that the property of the class has the value or .

summary.para: Gets a value specifying whether the operating system is using visual styles to draw controls.

remarks.para: This property gets the HRESULT value that was returned by the last native visual styles API method called by a member of the class. For more information about the native visual styles API, see "Using Windows XP Visual Styles" in the Platform SDK portion of the MSDN Library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library.

summary.para: Gets the last error code returned by the native visual styles (UxTheme) API methods encapsulated by the class.

remarks.para: This property identifies a particular specialization of a class. For more information about the class, part, and state of a visual style element, see the class.

summary.para: Gets the part of the current visual style element.

Docs.param: A that specifies the new values of the , , and properties.
